court: HIGH COURT OF KERALA AT ERNAKULAM PRESENT THE HONOURABLE MRS
outcome: /JUDGMENT CC 1641/2023 OF JUDICIAL MAGISTRATE OF FIRST CLASS -II, PERINTHALMANNA PETITIONERS /ACCUSED: 1 MUHAMMED SHAFI N.U AGED 37 YEARS S/O. YUSUF, NEDUMBA HOUSE, PULIKKALPARAMBIL, KOLAPARAMBU, P.O
full_text: BENS ee BEMeaears 2024/KER/4886 IN THE HIGH COURT OF KERALA AT ERNAKULAM PRESENT THE HONOURABLE MRS. JUSTICE SOPHY THOMAS MONDAY, THE 22 DAY OF JANUARY 2024 / 2ND MAGHA, 1945 CRL.MC NO. 19 OF 2024 CRIME NO.829/2023 OF Pandikad Police Station, Malappuram AGAINST THE ORDER/JUDGMENT CC 1641/2023 OF JUDICIAL MAGISTRATE OF FIRST CLASS -II, PERINTHALMANNA PETITIONERS /ACCUSED: 1 MUHAMMED SHAFI N.U AGED 37 YEARS S/O. YUSUF, NEDUMBA HOUSE, PULIKKALPARAMBIL, KOLAPARAMBU, P.O PANDIKKAD, MALAPPURAM DISTRICT., PIN - 676521 2 SULAIKHA P AGED 57 YEARS w/o. YUSUF, NEDUMBA HOUSE, PULIKKALPARAMBIL, KOLAPARAMBU, P.O PANDIKKAD, MALAPPURAM DISTRICT., PIN - 676521 3 NASEERA N AGED 38 YEARS W/O SUNEER BABU, PATTIKKADAN HOUSE, MALIYEKKAL, KOORAD, KALIKAVU P.O, MALAPPURAM DISTRICT., PIN - 676525 BY ADV P.SAMSUDIN RESPONDENTS/STATE AND DEFACTO COMPLAINANT: 1 STATE OF KERALA REPRESENTED BY PUBLIC PROSECUTOR,HIGH COURT OF KERALA, PIN - 682031 RAFVANA THASNI 2 AGED 20 YEARS D/O KABEER, KARAKKADAN HOUSE, KARUTHENI, KEEPPADA, VANIYAMBALAM, MALAPPURAM DISTRICT., PIN - 679339 SR.PP-SRI.RENJIT GEORGE THIS CRIMINAL MISC. CASK HAVING COME UP FOR ADMISSION ON 22.01.2024, THR COURT ON THE SAMR DAY PASSED THE FOLLOWING: [alan 2024/KER/4886 CRL.MC NO.19 OF 2024 2 ORDER Dated this the 22" day of January , 2024 This Crl.M.C., under Section 482 of CrP.C., is filed by accused Nos.1 to 3 in Crime No.829 of 2023 of Pandikkad Police Station, Malappuram, registered under Sections 498A and 406 r/w Section 34 of IPC, for quashing Annexure Ail FIR and Annexure A2 final report in C.C.No.1641 of 2023 on the file of Judicial First Class Magistrate Court-II, Perinthalmanna. 2. The prosecution allegation is that, accused Nos.1 to 3, who are the husband and in-laws of the defacto complainant/2 respondent, subjected her to matrimonial cruelties, demanding more gold and money. 3. When the matter is taken up for consideration, learned counsel for the petitioners submitted that the matter stands settled between themselves and the defacto complainant/2 respondent. The defacto complainant entered appearance through counsel, and submitted that [alan 2024/KER/4886 CRL.MC NO.19 OF 2024 the matter is settled, and Annexure A3 is the affidavit filed by her, endorsing the settlement. She has no intention to proceed with the prosecution. She has no objection in quashing the proceedings pending against the petitioners pursuant to Crime No.829 of 2023 of Pandikkad Police Station. 4. On instructions, learned Public Prosecutor submitted that the matter is settled, and produced the signed statement of the 2" respondent, to the effect that she is not intending to proceed with the prosecution, and she has no objection in quashing Annexure Al FIR and Annexure A2 final report in Crime No.829 of 2023 of Pandikkad Police Station pending as C.C.No.1641 of 2023. 5. Since the matter stands settled, no purpose would be served by continuing the prosecution against the petitioners. 6. In the light of the principles laid down by the Apex Court in Gian Singh v. State of Punjab and Another; Reta oe Ea Pa 2024/KER/4886 CRL.MC NO.19 OF 2024 4 [(2012) 10 SCC 303) ], and State of Madhya Pradesh v. Laxmi Narayan and Others; [(2019) 5 SCC 688], this Court is of the view that the proceedings against the petitioners can be quashed on the basis of settlement. Moreover, the dispute is purely personal in nature, and no public interest is involved in it. In the result, this Crl.M.C. is allowed and Annexures Al and A2, the FIR and final report respectively, in Crime No.829 of 2023 of Pandikkad Police Station, pending as C.C.No.1641 of 2023 on the file of Judicial First Class Magistrate Court-II, Perinthalmanna, stand quashed. Sd/- SOPHY THOMAS JUDGE SSK/22/01 lea el ee RG oe HR eerire 2024/KER/4886 CRL.MC NO.19 OF 2024 5 APPENDIX OF CRL.MC 19/2024 PETITIONER ANNEXURES Annexure -Al CERTIFIED COPY OF FIR IN CRIME NO. 829/2023 OF PANDIKKAD POLICE STATION DATED 02-11-2023. Annexure -A2 CERTIFIED COPY OF FINAL REPORT IN CRIME NO. 829/2023 OF PANDIKKAD POLICE STATION DATED 30-11-2023. Annexure -A3 THE ORIGINAL AFFIDAVIT DATED 15-12-2023 SWORN BY THE 2ND RESPONDENT
